newsitem.title: SPAIN: TENNIS-SELES TO FACE NOVOTNA IN MADRID OPEN FINAL.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-SELES TO FACE NOVOTNA IN MADRID OPEN FINAL.

text.p: Top seed Monica Seles will face second seed Jana Novotna in the Madrid Open women's tennis final after they secured contrasting semifinal wins on Friday.
Seles recovered after dropping the first set to beat unseeded Argentine Florencia Labat 6-7 6-1 6-2.
Novotna ended Spanish hopes by trouncing third-seeded Arantxa Sanchez Vicario 6-2 6-2.
Seles said she committed many errors at key moments during the first set when the wind also affected her game.
The American also said she felt nervous but gained control when her concentration improved.
Labat said her serve was the key to overcoming Seles in the first set.
"In the first set, I hardly committed any errors," she said. After that, Labat said she lost her rhythm while Seles was consistent.
Czech Novotna, looked ahead to Saturday's final with Seles, said: "I know it will be difficult. I have to be very aggressive."
